Pages deleted by Author without replication access will not be deleted properly from Content repo. 

This is a known issue with AEM which doesn't show pages in UI but content is still in Repository. Since ISA workflow runs on binder which grabs all child pages and pushed to vault. As the external ID was same for all these hidden pages the page that matches(Ex:Dosing) with external ID will be versioned multiple times.

Mean while authors should not delete any pages, and can request OPS(MSP-AEMSupport <MSP-AEMSupport@abbvie.com>) to delete any pages.

Below are approaches we could do to fix the issue :

*Approach 1* - NOVA authoring group should be provided with Replicate access, as there is no live website for this, replicating a page to publish will not have any risk. Additionally we should put a deny rule in dispatcher to not access '/content/nova' node .

*Approach 2* - Create a backend service to delete page when Deleted property is added

*Approach 3* - Create a Day care ticket.

column1: [PUNTED 3pts. - Xp 5pts.] [QA & Authoring Guide] Abbreviated Load Sheet Automated generation workflow
column32:
* All Load Sheet Fields are required to be present in the file although the fields can stay empty.
 * Order of the fields must be the same as sample load sheet. [^US-RNQR-240001_LS.csv]
 * XpConnect will retrieve the values of the following fields post ISA upload in Veeva to generate the custom Load Sheet artifact.
 * Following fields are required to be pulled in the Load Sheet - 
 ** Fields Only
 *** Hardcoded text "FALSE"
 *** Will be handed by XpConnect while generating Load Sheet
 ** name_{_}v{_}
 *** Slide (page) Title in AEM
 *** Auto determined & populated by XpConnect
 ** {_}lifecycle{_}{_}vpres.franchise_abv{_}{_}c{_}
 *** Will be defined in Metadata Composer as "{*}Presentation Franchise Code{*}" 
 *** Value will be populated by "{_}Brand Super Author"{_} in the Metadata Composer for the specific ISA
 *** Will be available as Read Only field in Binder page property
 ** {_}slide.franchise_abv{_}{_}c{_}
 *** Will be defined in Metadata Composer as *"Slide Franchise Code"* 
 *** Value will be populated by "{_}Brand Super Author"{_} in the Metadata Composer for the specific ISA
 *** Will be available as Read Only field in Slide page property
 ** _type_
 *** Auto determined & populated by XpConnect
 ** _pres.external_idv_
 *** Auto determined & populated by XpConnect
 *** (not editable in XpCOnnect today. Workaround exists to update it but may require product enhancement if needed to be made editable)
 ** {_}pres.external_id{_}{_}c{_}
 *** _Called Compass ID in Veeva. Stores Material Document # for the presentation. This is the reference where the Load sheet is attached to._
 *** Will be defined in Metadata Composer as *"Presentation Compass ID"* 
 *** Value will be populated by "{_}Brand Super Author"{_} in the Metadata Composer for the specific ISA
 ** {_}slide.external_id{_}{_}v{_}
 *** Auto determined & populated by XpConnect
 *** (not editable in XpConnect today. Workaround exists to update it but may require product enhancement if needed to be made editable)
 ** {_}slide.external_id{_}{_}c{_}
 *** _Called Compass ID in Veeva._ _Stores Material Document # for the Slide (can be different for slide if routed separately)._ _This is the reference where the Load sheet is attached to._
 *** Will be defined in Metadata Slide Composer as *"Slide Compass ID"* 
 *** Value will be populated by "{_}Brand Super Author"{_} in the Metadata Slide Composer for the specific slides within a ISA
 ** {_}pres.clm_content{_}_v
 *** Auto determined & populated by XpConnect
 *** Value will be hardcoded to "TRUE"

h1. Generation / Integration Logic

Create a new workflow process in XpConnect® that can:
 * Generate a CSV file
 * Upload it to vault
 * Create a Supporting Document relationship to a material Document.

This new workflow process will be added as the last step on the Current presentation binder upload step in XpConnect® Workflow; Like highlighted below.

!image-2024-04-30-00-51-27-132.png|width=737,height=321!

 
 * *Generate a CSV file* (ISAAP-96)
 ** XpConnect workflow process will have the CSV Headers read from JCR nodes under /conf/XpConnect.
 ** {color:#172b4d}-When a workflow is initiated on multiple binders in AEM; this process should still generate a single CSV file creating a row for each presentation and slide.- {color}
 ** {color:#172b4d}the Headers for the CSV should be configurable on nd should indicate if the field is required, so process can use them on csv.{color}
 ** The File name for csv file should be: %EXTERNAL_ID_{_}C OF_BINDER%{_}_LS.csv
 ** Values for the required fields will be pulled from source in as mentioned in above requirement.

 
 * *Upload it to vault:* (ISAAP-99)

 * 
 ** the Document type, lifecycle and other required metadata fields to upload the csv file, will be available on JCR node.  Location and structure will be determined by Xpediant team. Below are the required fields for uploading a LoadSheet.

 * 
 ** Type : Digital Support Documents
 *** Subtype: Load Sheet
 *** Name:  %EXTERNAL_ID_{_}C OF_BINDER%{_}_LS.csv
 *** Country: United States
 *** Product: Product of the binder/slide

 
 * {*}Create a Supporting Document relationship to a material Document{*}.(ISAAP-98)
 ** XpConnect once receives the upload confirmation from vault, should lookup for the external_id_{_}c value of the binder (if there are multiple binders within the loadsheet all of them will have a same external_id{_}_c value to which the supporting document relationship to the uploaded loadsheet is created.

 
 * *Failure case Handling* (ISAAP-101)
 **  if the csv generation or upload fails due to missing data,
 *** XpConnect to should notify the workflow initiator via email with detailed reasons for failure
 *** XpConnect - Push To Veeva Vault option should show additional Option "Associate Load Sheet" which should re-trigger the above flow for Load sheet generation, uploading in Veeva and association with the relevant Binder.

h1. Testing Scope / Considerations

In all below cases the metadata, required for slides and binders and distribution package is expected to be uploaded, unless there is required metadata fields missing.

*Test Case 1 (+ve):*  Initiate XpC workflow on a single binder with all metadata provided above.
 * Are the binder and slides uploaded to Veeva with loadsheet attached?
 * Is VIA able to perform its actions based on the load sheet attached (refer to ISAAP-55 for VIA test scenarios) 

*Test Case 2 (-ve):* Initiate XpC workflow on a single binder with excluding few required metadata fields Listed above.Are the binder and slides uploaded in Veeva with load-sheet attached ? No; Did the author receive an email on failure ? Yes (Refer to Failure Case Task for scenario details)
